meanings: (말의) exchanging words, talk, a remark, a comment, ―하다 exchange words, talk, say, remark, comment
(엉큼한 속셈) a crap, a nonsense, an applesause(미·구)

examples.korean: Is that your best chat-up line? 발음듣기 그게 당신이 수작을 걸 때 하는 최고의 발언이에요? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Is that your best chat-up line? 발음

examples.korean: I can see through your little game. 발음듣기 당신의 되잖은 수작을 난 간파할 수 있어. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I can see through your little game. 발음

examples.korean: She engineered a further meeting with him. 발음듣기 그녀는 그와 한 번 더 만나려고 수작을 부렸다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She engineered a further meeting with him. 발음

examples.korean: She went straight over and tried to chat him up. 발음듣기 그녀는 곧 바로 그에게로 가서 수작을 걸어 보려고 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She went straight over and tried to chat him up. 발음

examples.korean: The new teacher won’t stand for any nonsense. 발음듣기 그 새 선생님은 허튼수작은 어떤 것도 용납하지 않으신다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The new teacher won’t stand for any nonsense. 발음
